messages: 48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:34): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, I'm just reading through some boilerplate code again and there's something I can't figure out
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:34): perhaps it's my lack of sleep
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:35): why does this line need the !(IE) :
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:35): I'm probably overlooking something stupid here
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:36): i think the inner comment isnt legit in CondComment land without the !IE
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:37): it'd also be quite a mindfuck as the code would be quite confusing if we removed !IE
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:37): I took a look at the git history and I could see the point before
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:38): because it was on separate lines
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:39): but it's no so obvious now

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (18:40): Looks like something that should be disabled for IE <= 8 without being hidden from non-IE users. The "!(IE)" comment is superfluous as non-IE browsers don't support conditional comments.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (18:41): i.e. the !IE is just there to play safe in case someone else decides to adhere to conditional comments.
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:42): hmm actually I think I remember reading something about that now
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:42): something about it causing problems in Dreamweaver
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:44): well there was the dreamweaver issue
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:45): but this is after a rewrite of that.
fcaf66fab1c867ac1cfc1fd419ed4a62 (18:46): dreamweaver is always an issue!
fcaf66fab1c867ac1cfc1fd419ed4a62 (18:47): I suggest the boilerplate wraps the whole site in <![if !IE]>
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:47): fcaf66fab1c867ac1cfc1fd419ed4a62: did you see the top of w3fools markup?
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (18:52): Wait. Right angle brackets don't need escaping?
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:55): "&lt 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa> Wait. Right angle brackets don't need escaping?"
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (18:55): 48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137: What does self-closing have to do with entities?
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (18:57): oh never mind, thought you were referring to something else
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:01): ... you thought I mistook the self-closing slash in XML for escaping?
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:02): 48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137: I've been writing HTML since about 1997. I'm pretty confident I know what I'm talking about.
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (19:03): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, yeah but how am i to know that
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (19:03): also im sleep deprived and just finished reading a very related article
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (19:03): so my tiny mind was still a little focused on it
48ea35779120c2a294e7ab000f4a2137 (19:05): since what you said had no other content for some reason I invented my own :)
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:06): It was a bit of a leap, though.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:11): my brother lives in stuttgart. i'm in .de often
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:12): he's one of the leads of jQuery UI. lives in cologne.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:13): It's neat, but it's terribly hard to customize. It's easy to _theme_, though.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:14): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: Also, I'm sorry to say, but I prefer mootools over jQuery. It's too much magic for my taste.
14d0a6d6b68e3c33343a1c813af6a4dc (19:32): cya all have a nice evening
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:41): This is interesting: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFsQvcdmLxc (Marissa Mayer on the effect of latency on user responses)
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (19:45): All the talk about tables is making me dizzy, though.
